top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Burn's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
Gravel Burn's South African highveld gravel (85%), Dirt roads (15%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
8,202ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
132ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Gravel Burn, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
62 miles on south African highveld—rolling red dirt gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
8,202ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Burn. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Burn, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on south African highveld—rolling red dirt gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Low-cadence force work for 8,202ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Base fitness for Gravel Burn. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Burn’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel Burn. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Burn requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on south african highveld—rolling red dirt gravel to build confidence. Expect: south african highveld gravel (85%), dirt roads (15%), red dirt roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of south african highveld—rolling red dirt gravel in Mpumalanga, South Africa.
